channel.title: The Geek Trading Co.
channel.description: Recent content on The Geek Trading Co.

item.title: Tags
item.description: These are the site tags:

item.title: About the Geek Trading Co.
item.description: ratboy is widely (in)famous for his almost tectonic painting speed. That’s not to say that he play with unpainted miniatures; just that he tries to avoid it as often as possible. He was, at one time, whispered about in fearful tones anywhere players of toy soldiers gather. In Melbourne. he is the man, the myth, the legend: Ratboy! You have to just know that there’s a story behind that nikcname, right?

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact ratboy from the Geek Trading Co. here:

item.title: Heretic tears mug
item.description: Heretic Tears. Direct from the heretic to you. Secret fuel for all Inquisition warriors. Ceramic 11 oz mug dimensions: 3.85″ (9.8 cm) in height, 3.35″ (8.5 cm) in diameter 15 oz mug dimensions: 4.7″ (12 cm) in height, 3.35″ (8.5 cm) in diameter Dishwasher and microwave safe Blank product sourced from China This product is made especially for you as soon as you place an order, which is why it takes us a bit longer to deliver it to you.

item.title: Keep calm and declare Exterminatus sticker
item.description: Keep calm and declare Exterminatus These stickers are printed on durable, high opacity adhesive vinyl which makes them perfect for regular use, as well as for covering other stickers or paint. The high-quality vinyl ensures there are no bubbles when applying the stickers. *High opacity film that’s impossible to see through Fast and easy bubble-free application Durable vinyl, perfect for indoor use 95µ density Don’t forget to clean the surface before applying the sticker.

item.title: Keep calm and get more Dakka t-shirt
item.description: DAKKA!! DAKKA!! DAKKA Ghazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka, the scourge of Armageddon knows it. The Arch-Maniac of Calverna knows it. Skullkrumpa knows it. Across the 41st millennium Ork of all sizes and significance know it. Keep Calm And Get More DAKKA! It’s a universal Ork-y truth. This t-shirt is everything you’ve dreamed of and more. It feels soft and lightweight, with the right amount of stretch. It’s comfortable and flattering for all.

item.title: Keep calm and roll double pow
item.description: Keep calm and roll double pows These stickers are printed on durable, high opacity adhesive vinyl which makes them perfect for regular use, as well as for covering other stickers or paint. The high-quality vinyl ensures there are no bubbles when applying the stickers. *High opacity film that’s impossible to see through Fast and easy bubble-free application Durable vinyl, perfect for indoor use 95µ density Don’t forget to clean the surface before applying the sticker.

item.title: Nuffle he hates me sticker
item.description: Nuffle is a bastard! These stickers are printed on durable, high opacity adhesive vinyl which makes them perfect for regular use, as well as for covering other stickers or paint. The high-quality vinyl ensures there are no bubbles when applying the stickers. *High opacity film that’s impossible to see through Fast and easy bubble-free application Durable vinyl, perfect for indoor use 95µ density Don’t forget to clean the surface before applying the sticker.

item.title: Straight outta Cadia Sticker
item.description: Cadia guarded the only known navigable route to and from the massive Warp rift known as the Eye of Terror, a passage called the Cadian Gate. The world’s dangerous proximity to the Eye of Terror made it necessary for the people of Cadia to heavily fortify the planet. Cadia still STANDS! This t-shirt is everything you’ve dreamed of and more. It feels soft and lightweight, with the right amount of stretch.

item.title: Straight outta Cadia t-shirt
item.description: Cadia guarded the only known navigable route to and from the massive Warp rift known as the Eye of Terror, a passage called the Cadian Gate. The world’s dangerous proximity to the Eye of Terror made it necessary for the people of Cadia to heavily fortify the planet. Cadia still STANDS! This t-shirt is everything you’ve dreamed of and more. It feels soft and lightweight, with the right amount of stretch.

item.title: The Emperor Protects t-shirt
item.description: This t-shirt is everything you’ve dreamed of and more. It feels soft and lightweight, with the right amount of stretch. It’s comfortable and flattering for all. 100% combed and ring-spun cotton (Heather colors contain polyester) Fabric weight: 4.2 oz/yd² (142 g/m²) Pre-shrunk fabric Side-seamed construction Shoulder-to-shoulder taping Blank product sourced from Guatemala, Nicaragua, Mexico, Honduras, or the US This product is made especially for you as soon as you place an order, which is why it takes us a bit longer to deliver it to you.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #01
item.description: The inaugural issue of the world’s, possibly, greatest wargames hobby magazine. ISSUE ONE contents: Malifaux hobby log Painting tutorials Making enamel washes Kings of War reviews and battle report Batman Miniatures Game review Scenery tutorials PHAT Models featuring Warpstorm Painting Other cool stuff …

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #02
item.description: The much anticipated second issue of The Golden D6. Six months after Issue One seems like more than enough time to wait for the second issue and I am disgustingly proud and excited for you to finally get a look at it. In this issue Shizune Paints shows us how to paint blue armour Allied Wargaming present Bolt Action for the Hobbyist Evil Nevets painting show off an awesome looking Combined Army Fraacta from Infinity We’re introduced to the cast and crew at Metalhead Minis Haaaaave you met … Andy?

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #03
item.description: “Only one month? Surely you must be joking?!” “I’m not joking and don’t call me Shirley!” The new issue of the Golden D6. Along with the one and only Queen Bee from Jeff Tibbetts The Golden D6 features: A Warhammer 40000 battle report from The Burning Eye Eric the Shed brings us a 28mm Pillbox terrain tutorial An amazing Dwarf Slayer painting tutorial from Kujo Painting Joe Baird’s back and this time he’s brought monsters!

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #04
item.description: “Only one month? Surely you must be joking?!” “I’m not joking and don’t call me Shirley!” The new issue of the Golden D6. Along with the one and only Queen Bee from Jeff Tibbetts The Golden D6 features: A Warhammer 40000 battle report from The Burning Eye Eric the Shed brings us a 28mm Pillbox terrain tutorial An amazing Dwarf Slayer painting tutorial from Kujo Painting Joe Baird’s back and this time he’s brought monsters!

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #05
item.description: It’s … The new issue of the Golden D6. The Golden D6 Issue Five has a heap of great stuff in it: A Fistful of Kung Fu interview with Andrea Sfiligoi An awesome Star Wars Imperial Assault battle report by Matthew Sullivan Guildball review and play guide from Dave at Mini Musings of a Bear Star Wars X-Wing battle report by Ali Ghosn An exclusive Warcolours’ paint range review by Joe Baird Frostgrave Deadite warband by Mr.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #06
item.description: The Golden D6. Issue Six. 6D6! It’s a dice thing. In our first big experiment, it’s the all tutorial issue. We’ve plumbed the depths of the internet to bring you eleven inspiring tutorials! The Issue contains: An air brush maintenance tutorial from Melbourne’s own Steve King Painting a Combined army Oznat from Andrew House An Iron Warrior’s painting guide from Edd Ralph Display bases for miniatures An awesome Ikea Modular Dungeon Tutorial from Shedwars DIY Gaming Tokens from the #Spruegrey Nation’s own Metal Valkyrie from Metalhead Minis Toilet paper terrain.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #07
item.description: The Golden D6 Issue Seven is special. Not because it’s the number seven, but more that this represents the one year anniversary of the Golden D6 monthly magazine. Well, nearly monthly. It’s a work in progress. Thanks to one and all for reading and support I’d like to particularly thank: Matt Weaver for his awesome designs Joe Baird, the GD6 OG James Mason for help with the proofreading (any of the mistakes are his fault, not mine!

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #08
item.description: STOP! DO NOT BUY THIS MAGAZINE Unless … You want to learn how to paint Ork skin like a freaking beast thanks to David Colwell You want to learn how to magnetize an Imperial Knight for Warhammer 40000! Better than that, this can be applied to any larger scale model You’re a little bit Malifaux-curious Dishdash Games’ Zombie survival scenarios are interesting You’re a fan of Rex Foote’s awesome Kings of War narrative battle reports You want to read one of the most complete tree building tutorials ever from Dagger and Brush Over 100 pages of hobby tutorials, battle reports and reviews designed by the talented Melissa Jones.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #09
item.description: Just in time for last minute Chrismas shopping, it’s the Golden D6 Issue #9 Featuring: Maintenance of reindeer and other live stock A review of Dragon Rampant. Turning Fantasy gaming up to 11! Get your teeth kicked in by a Seraphim. Part two of our feature of the Silver Demon winning “Hammer of Wrath” What to do if you overdose on chocolate Totally #TeamTony. How to paint Knight Model’s, Iron Man A fascinating dissertation on the theory of Painting Busts No box can contain Super Dungeon Explore!

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #10
item.description: The Golden D6 Issue #10; the Showcase Issue! Featuring: Iron Fate by Thor at Creative Twilight Look Away a zombie diorama by David Colwell Painting the demon’s bust by Nils Holmbergh Horus the Warmaster by Rory Priest Zombies In Space by Stats Alexander’s Sylvaneth Army Fabius Bile by Joe Baird The Fallen Angel, Cypher by Duane Wood The Witch Queen by Nils Holmbergh Harley Quinn and the Sleeping Chibi by Neil Szabo Part three of Hammer of Wrath by Rory Priest The Warlock of Firetop Mountain diaromma by Stuart Bannister Kingdom Death … after dark by Scott Ferguson The Golden D6 is designed by the talented Melissa Jones.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #11
item.description: The Golden D6 Issue #11 Featuring: A painting tutorial by Chris at Nightshade Miniatures Ancient Vaako from Khorne’s Eternal Hunt Our cover feature on the Iron Snakes from Marc A T.N.T warband and background from Matt Detail Painting Deathguard from Adpaint Medieval Huts from Oakbound Studio Frostgrave terrain tutorials from Richbuilds.com Malifaux Sky Pirates from Sean Kings of War Drakon Rider conversions from Pawel at Path of an Outcast The Golden D6 is designed by the talented Melissa Jones.

item.title: The Golden D6 Issue #12
item.description: Issue 12 of the Golden D6 features: More Dakka den yoo is - A Warhammer 40K Ork Morkanaut painting tutorial from Joe Baird (the Golden D6 OG) A forest basing tutorial from Red Kitana How to become a better painter (in 12 easy steps) by Thor from Creative Twilight How to use laser cut ferns on your miniature’s base by Marc van Holst Beardy Bastards - A Warhammer 40K webcomic!
